dfischer.utils

Class HtmlContentParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HtmlContentParser

  • public class HtmlContentParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Extracts from a HTML response all hyperlinks and forms and stores then inside a hyperlink and a form table.

    Parsed Data Structure: 

     HtmlContentParser
 |
 +--- HtmlParserFormTable  (table of all forms)
 |    |
 |    +--- 1..n HtmlParserForm  (form)
 |         ¦
 |         +--- HtmlParserFormItemTable  (table of all form items)
 |              |
 |              +--- 1..n HtmlParserFormItem  (form item)
 |
 +--- HtmlParserHyperlinkTable  (table of all hyperlinks)
      |
      +--- 1..n  HtmlParserHyperlink  (hyperlink)
    See Also:
    HttpTestURL, HtmlParserFormTable, HtmlParserHyperlinkTable

    • Constructor Detail

      • HtmlContentParser

        public HtmlContentParser(byte[] content,
                 LogVector logVector)
        Parses the HTML content of a HTTP response and extracts all hyperlinks and forms.
        Parameters:
        content - HTML content (input data)
        logVector - log vector to which parsing exceptions or errors are written. This parameter can also be null - in such case exceptions or errors are written to stdout or stderr
        See Also:
        HttpTestURL.getContentType(), HttpTestURL.getDecompressedContent()

      • HtmlContentParser

        public HtmlContentParser(byte[] content,
                 java.lang.String charEncoding,
                 LogVector logVector)
        Parses the HTML content of a HTTP response and extracts all hyperlinks and forms.
        Parameters:
        content - HTML content (input data)
        charEncoding - allows to fix the character encoding to a specific character set like "ISO-8859-1". Caution: usually null or "" (no value) should be passed to use the specified character set of the web page. Passing not null or "" is usually only used for malformed web pages.
        logVector - log vector to which parsing exceptions or errors are written. This parameter can also be null - in such case exceptions or errors are written to stdout or stderr
        See Also:
        HttpTestURL.getContentType(), HttpTestURL.getDecompressedContent()

      • HtmlContentParser

        public HtmlContentParser(HttpTestURL httpTestURL,
                 LogVector logVector)
        Parses the HTML content of a HTTP response and extracts all hyperlinks and forms.
        Parameters:
        httpTestURL - reference to a successful executed url call (input data)
        logVector - log vector to which parsing exceptions or errors are written. This parameter can also be null - in such case exceptions or errors are written to stdout or stderr
        See Also:
        HttpTestURL.getDecompressedContent()

                 java.lang.String charEncoding,

        Parses the HTML content of a HTTP response and extracts all hyperlinks and forms.
        Parameters:
        httpTestURL - reference to a successful executed url call (input data)
        charEncoding - allows to fix the character encoding to a specific character set like "ISO-8859-1". Caution: usually null or "" (no value) should be passed to use the specified character set of the web page. Passing not null or "" is usually only used for malformed web pages.
        logVector - log vector to which parsing exceptions or errors are written. This parameter can also be null - in such case exceptions or errors are written to stdout or stderr

    • Method Detail

      • hasHyperlinks

        public boolean hasHyperlinks()
        Determines if the HTML content contains hyperlinks.
        Returns:
        true if the HTML content contains hyperlinks.

      • getHyperlinkTable

        public HtmlParserHyperlinkTable getHyperlinkTable()
        Returns a table of all hyperlinks.
        Returns:
        table of all hyperlinks. Returns an empty table if no hyperlinks are found.

      • hasForms

        public boolean hasForms()
        Determines if the HTML content contains forms.
        Returns:
        true if the HTML content contains forms.

      • getFormTable

        public HtmlParserFormTable getFormTable()
        Returns a table of all forms.
        Returns:
        table of all forms. Returns an empty table if no forms are found.

      • extractUrlRewriteParamValue

        public java.lang.String extractUrlRewriteParamValue(java.lang.String urlRewriteParamName)
        Extracts the first URL rewrite parameter value found on any hyperlink or form action within the content (support of the J2EE URL rewriting technology).
        Parameters:
        urlRewriteParamName - the name of the URL rewrite parameter. This is usually "jsessionid". The search for the parameter name is case insensitive.
        Returns:
        the value of the first located URL rewrite parameter or null if no URL rewriting was found on any hyperlink or form action.
